author: Li N.
text:
I have been buying a lot from VC and everything was fine until last week.  I've bought a Balmain dress.  Seller listed as size 36 FR, "never worn, new with tag".  When it came to me the dress does not have any size tag and it's bigger than size 36.  I have contacted VC and requested a return due to "item not as described".  VC has denied my request saying the seller is an individual seller so I cannot return.  I was not asking to return because I changed mind or because I did not like the dress.  I wanted to return because it is not the size it was listed as.  VC does not protect buyers from dishonest sellers.

The reference #18789442.  I wonder why the inspector found the difference in listed fabric contents but she did not see that the dress is missing the size tag?
Thank you so much to VC allowing me to return now.  I appreciate your care for your buyers.  This issue is resolved now. 11-17-2021.  Li.

author: JS
text:
VC is unable to handle transactions involving fur (and other things) being imported to the UK. They claim it is due to Brexit but all other platforms I know of are able to do this (eg Rebelle in Germany, eBay, Joli Closet in France. 

No UK-UK sales are possible because their system defaults to the item being sent to France for checking - hence needing to be imported back to the UK (although Direct Selling would make the checking unnecessary).

1) Why are Vestiaire claiming it's an issue out of their control when their competitors aren't experiencing it?

2) It appears that discussing on the Chat that fur sales can be made on other platforms gets one banned. Why - what are they afraid of? It's their choice to not support UK-UK fur sales.
title: Discuss not being able to sell fur in UK and get banned.

author: G. E.
text:
I sold an item on the 1st of November, shipped the same day, however the item seems to be lost by the carrier, which can happen, however to get Vestiaire to get active was quite a chore. Chat is a waste of time. Finally they concluded that the item was indeed lost, however to pay me, they now want an ID, a passport or a driving license.
Here is the problem:
The UK has no ID cards, I have epilepsy, so I am legally not allowed to drive and since I can't travel much anyway (long journeys can trigger epilepsy) I have no passport.
I thought it was not a problem, I am married, so I use my husbands driving license and utility bill, now the system doesn't recognize it, despite the fact that we have the same surname, I even changed my account information to his information (looks a bit weird if a man is selling women's clothes, but hey) apparently it is still pending.
I tried to go to chat and as usual it was a really bad experience, the customer service agent (Jose Jiggo) spammed me with auto replies, obviously didn't read a single thing and told me to empty my chache, which has nothing to do with the fact that Vestiaire claims they can't verify my ID. I tried to ask if they would accept a letter from the National Health Service, a birth certificate, a marriage certificate, I was told to restart my computer.
To sum it up, your carrier has lost the item, you now create hurdles to avoid to pay me. I really can't force the UK government to issue ID cards, ordering a passport is quite expensive and since I can't travel no use to me, and since I am not allowed to drive due to health reasons, how could I get a driving license? 
I am not being rude, but you are hardly the most organised company, so you do demand very sensitive documents which I supplied (in the form of my husband's documents due to before mentioned reasons) and I have no idea what happens with them, how securely they are kept....
title: The UK has no ID cards

author: Amy Kilian
text:
Really poor experience. I bought a ‘La Perla’ silk dressing gown (order no: 46698796 ) that after purchase I noticed was not showing the belt, I queried as to why & was told it has been lost,  so I contacted Vestiaire to cancel (as the seller has refused to accept a cancellation) all of this was before it had been dispatched I hasten to add. Vestiaire said that the seller didn’t state it had a belt so therefore it was not missing a belt ! ( despite the gown having loops for one) Then to add insult to injury when the item arrived it was worn looking with a small hole and bobbled worn areas, and a thread pull.  The seller had said she’d only worn it a few times, which was a blatant lie judging by the condition and anyone inspecting could see that. 
I immediately took pictures ( which I am happy to share on here ) and sent them to Vestiare requesting a full refund of all costs incurred by me, the refund was unacceptably denied but they agreed to have it reevaluated and a full refund would be issued upon the findings. I was assured by customer services that they were aware that the item had been sent after I’d cancelled it and that there would be no issue in returning for a full refund, they said they had also made note of the sellers behaviour in this. It was then to my real surprise that they then re-evaluated it ( as in inspected it ) & said that item was acceptable to sell !! Shockingly poor. The response also  stated  that they were now trying to resell it on my behalf ( which is pity for the next poor buyer but out of my hands).  This was all via an email that you could not respond back to: no-reply@emails, which is not at all helpful. 
I would  have expected a full refund in a case like this, together with an absolute apology. I won’t be shopping with them ever again and would say to anyone considering it - buyer beware,  It feels  more like dealing with a dodgy EBay seller only with EBay you have some  recourse as a buyer in a case  like this.

Edit: Fortunately I payed via Klarna who upon hearing of this issue suspended payment and have opened an enquiry into Vestiare Collective
title: Really poor experience

author: Jindk
text:
Deleting the app ASAP!! 
Sent me a blazer that was altered beyond belief. There was material added to enlarge the width of the sleeves, the lining was replaced and sewn in crookedly and the labels were missing. When I tried to explain this to customer service, they had a very serious comprehension problem and could barely speak English. Out of sheer frustration, I had to send the blazer back to France AT MY EXPENSE and they only ended  up refunding me a portion of my cost and also lost the duties and taxes I had to pay at check out! An absolute waste of time and money. It is beyond me as to why I paid for authentication when clearly the item was not in its original state. I hope to see the same sellers on eBay or Depop because Vestiaire is not the way for me.
title: Deleting the app ASAP!
